page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The area is very beautiful with rich green meadows, rolling hills and valleys with small streams. Electricity pylons mar some of the beauty. Agriculture is the main form of employment. There are two 'B' roads running through this area, the B4306 Pontyberem - Carmarthen and B4309 Pontyates - Carmarthen. All other roads are minor roads. The two villages are on the B4309 road, one is known as Meinciau, the other is Pontantwn. Meinciau is the larger, with council and private houses, bungalows, a public house known as the Black Horse, a recreation area with sports field, petrol station and chapel. Pontantwn only has a few houses, bungalows and petrol/service garage.
